name: Benjamin Franklin
description: Benjamin Franklin (January 17, 176-april 1790) was a well-known figure in the United States and had left much work in his life. Franklin was a man of many kinds of work and expertise. He was a journalist, publisher, author, philanthropist, abolitionist, public servant (official), scientist, diplomat, and inventor all at once. Franklin was also one of the leaders of the American revolution, and one of the signers of the American declaration of independence. His words are a lot of well-known and widely quoted. For example, "time is money" would likely come from him. Since he was also a publisher and a printing owner, many of his words remain accessible to this day because of his extensive and diligent writing. He's also famous for his experiments on electricity. He was the first head of the American post office, the maker of the first "public library," and the first person to organize the city's fire lines.
